<a href="https://fundrise.com/acq-plus/start?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=primary-20200213&utm_content=all" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Fundrise" style="width:100%;max-width: 145px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="145" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8zNS8xNTc2MDc3MTgwLWZ1bmRyaXNlLWxvZ28ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>and welcome back to Merger Week. Just three days left <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt="">.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before we get to the good stuff, a shocking, <em>shocking </em>revelation from the world of pizza. It turns out Papa John may not have eaten over 40 pizzas in 30 days as he appeared to claim in November. Speaking on the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XGtMMYWhdUU&feature=youtu.be&t=976" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">H3 podcast</a>, Papa clarified his remarks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I didn’t say I’d eaten 40 pizzas in 30 days, I said that I had 40 pizzas in 30 days.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“When I said I had a pizza, this means I’m inspecting...I’m not eating every pizza, I may be eating parts of pizzas.”</span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/bp-pledges-go-carbon-neutral-2050-ambitious-plan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
BP the Change You Wish to See in the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A BP fuel tank with a clock " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNTQyOTE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Energy major BP pledged yesterday <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bp-outlook/bp-boss-looney-sets-out-to-reinvent-oil-giant-with-zero-carbon-goal-idUSKBN2061IM?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to eliminate or offset all carbon emissions</a> from its operations and the products it sells by 2050.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture before we dive in: </strong>This is arguably the biggest strategic change at BP in its 111-year history, but with big oil 1) at the center of a climate crisis and 2) struggling to appease green-minded investors, generational shifts in ideology feel right for 2020. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now to the diving in</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BP isn’t the first big oil company to outline climate-friendlier goals, but its plan has one major distinction: BP aims to become a net zero carbon emitter in its own production plus cut the CO2 its customers create as they use that energy.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Most of the energy sector’s emissions come from people and businesses </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/1f66df4cb23e89da039517163ef80dc4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">using their products</a></span><span>. At BP, 55 million metric tons of carbon equivalent per year come from operations, while 360 million/year come from its oil + gas being operationa</span><span><em>lized</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So how does an oil and gas company solve a problem like CO2 pollution? BP will have to shift to cleaner energy sources while developing new tech to offset unavoidable emissions, aka yank CO2 from the atmosphere to make up for what it tosses up there.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">““It’s not the destination, it’s the journey” —Wayne Gretzky” —BP CEO Bernard Looney. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looney, who started last week, was heavy on “<a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51475379?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eye to the future</a>” vibes announcing the plans but light on details like timing and costs. And the 30 years between now and 2050, as the WSJ puts it, “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bp-wants-to-be-carbon-neutral-by-2050-11581517147?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provides plenty of wiggle room</a>.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What might need some wiggling: </strong></span><span>BP allocated 3.2% of its budget last year to investing in renewable energy (the industry average is 7.4%).</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the coming years, BP says it will reorganize to invest more in “low carbon businesses” and invest less in oil and gas. <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/feb/12/bp-sets-net-zero-carbon-target-for-2050?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">It’s unclear</a> how that vision becomes reality, but we know this: BP’s new strategy could <a href="https://www.axios.com/bp-carbon-emissions-net-zero-goal-c2e39709-5c9b-45b7-9cb6-dc6de6dee7b5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put pressure on U.S. oil majors</a> who’ve mostly been silent on climate issues.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/mobile-world-congress-canceled-coronavirus-fears?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MWC2020 Is Canceled
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="In this photo, Mobile World Congress 2017 booths are shown with scores of people surrounding them." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/18/MWC17.png">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Matt611" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Matt611</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MWC17.png" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MWC17</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What had been a celebratory week for the smartphone world—Samsung’s event, the T-Mobile/Sprint merger—quickly turned dark. The industry’s largest trade show, Mobile World Congress, was <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/12/gmsa-cancels-mobile-world-congress-due-to-coronavirus-concerns/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a> by organizers because of the coronavirus outbreak. It had been scheduled to take place later this month in Barcelona.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mobile World Congress (MWC) is a huge deal, which means canceling it is a huge deal. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over 100,000 people from 200 countries head to Catalonia each year to network about networks. The show generates 14,100 part-time jobs. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wireless carriers and, recently, manufacturers and Big Tech firms are all mainstays.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But MWC was <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/12/21127754/mwc-2020-canceled-coronavirus-trade-show-phone-mobile-world-congress-gsma-statement?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no match for the coronavirus</a>, which has stymied travel to and from China, a global hub for the smartphone industry. Roughly 5,000–6,000 people from China typically attend MWC.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Organizers had to decide between canceling the event and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/10/coronavirus-hit-mobile-world-congress-attendance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fielding the practice squad</a>. Some of the biggest players including Ericsson, Nokia, Amazon, LG, and Sony pulled out in recent weeks. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/bernie-blankfein-continue-war-words?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vest Side Story: Wall Street Rumbles With Bernie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNTQyNTI5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>John Moore/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jets and Sharks. Cardi B and Nicki Minaj. Add to the list of NYC feuds: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders and former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, (Bronx-born) Blankfein <a href="https://twitter.com/lloydblankfein/status/1227455415241363456?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> that (Brooklyn native) Sanders would “ruin our economy.” He also said Sanders “doesn’t care about our military” and “is just as polarizing as [President] Trump.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For good measure, he suggested that Sanders was such a weak candidate, Russians seeking to throw the U.S. election would be wise to support him. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sanders, whose platform includes taxing the rich and establishing a Hunger Games for hedge fund managers, won Tuesday’s New Hampshire Democratic primary. His hard-left policies are causing much concern among current Wall Streeters and its retiree community. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This isn’t a new show, just the latest episode. A year ago, Blankfein and Sanders <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/02/05/blankfein-hits-back-at-senators-over-stock-buybacks-the-money-doesnt-vanish.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter-sparred</a> over stock buybacks. And in 2012, <a href="https://www.sanders.senate.gov/newsroom/video-audio/lloyd-blankfein-is-the-face-of-class-warfare?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sanders called Blankfein</a> “the face of class warfare” from the Senate floor. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F12%2Fbernie-blankfein-continue-war-words" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>

</th>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/meditation-company-headspace-raises?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Headspace Takes a Big Inhale

</h1>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A cartoon person using Headspace app" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTQ3L2FfY2FydG9vbl9wZXJzb25fdXNpbmdfaGVhZHNwYWNlX2FwcC5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Headspace</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meditation company Headspace <a href="https://www.axios.com/scoop-headspace-raises-93-million-82a31014-2471-49de-8f64-452d8f656733.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced yesterday</a> it raised $93 million in a Series C funding round. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Headspace ushers users through guided meditations...and its numbers are approaching transcendence. The app has over 62 million downloads and more than 2 million paid subscribers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>The $93 million fundraise has two parts—$53 million in equity and $40 million in debt. Blisce led the equity round and Pacific Western Bank provided the debt. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The play: </strong>has three acts.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Headspace Health, the startup’s effort to integrate mindfulness into healthcare. The medical community hasn’t signed off on meditation as official medicine, so Headspace is investing in clinical research. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Headspace’s enterprise arm, Headspace for Work. H4W supports people at 600+ employers, and revenue has doubled in each of the past two years. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>International expansion. Headspace tapped a former Apple exec </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/12/headspace-raises-53-million-and-40-million-in-debt-as-it-pursues-clinical-validation-for-mindfulness/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to peddle</a></span><span> its French and German iterations across the pond. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Headspace is making moves, but it still has to contend with Calm, a rival app that reached unicorn status ($1+ billion valuation) last February.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/new-report-reveals-valentines-day-isnt-lucrative-local-restaurants?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Valentine’s Day Not an Aphrodisiac for Restaurants
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Big Mouth " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=670 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LXQ9cjWtTqJZw2Kg8i/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Big Mouth " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/LXQ9cjWtTqJZw2Kg8i/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite how hard it is to book an OpenTable on Valentine’s Day (do it now for a shot at 4:35pm), the holiday actually does relatively little for the restaurant biz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to Womply, Valentine’s Day 2019—a Thursday—<a href="https://www.womply.com/state-of-local-restaurants-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ranked 94th in the year</a> for consumer spending at local restaurants in the U.S., below even Cinco de Mayo.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We should caveat: </strong>Restaurants, particularly the dimly lit ones, do very well on Valentine’s Day, reporting a 30%–40% revenue increase from a typical day.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But, as Bloomberg reports, any old Saturday night is "</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-12/valentine-s-day-is-not-as-good-for-restaurants-as-you-d-think?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invariably better</a></span><span>" for local restaurants than a weekday Valentine’s. Average Saturdays generate 19.9% of weekly revenue and Fridays 18.9%.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And on </span><span><span style="text-decoration: line-through;">the most elaborate and well-executed corporate scam in history</span></span><span> Valentine’s Day, restaurants struggle to accommodate almost all two-tops that tend to linger longer than usual.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what holiday takes the cake?</strong> Unsurprisingly, Mother’s Day weekend, which accounts for the No. 1 and No. 2 top-grossing days of the year for local restaurants.</p>

MERGER WEEK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
How a Merger Actually Works
</font></a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’re through three days of Merger Week,</strong> so by now you’re an expert on <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/09/not-cuz-like-companies-merge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">why companies merge</a>, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/swipe-right-merge-companies-find-love?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how they meet</a>, and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/11/planning-merger-planning-unexpected?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what goes into the planning</a>. All that’s left to do is sign the darn thing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not. So. Fast. Is your merger all-cash? What about all-stock? Perhaps it’s a combo? Is a shell company involved? Is what we perceive reality or just a construct of our minds?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To answer those questions and more, we leave you in the capable hands of the Brew’s Alex Hickey, who walks you through how a merger <em>actually</em> works. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/12/merger-actually-works?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENERGY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBP the Change You Wish to See in the World\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A BP fuel tank with a clock \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxNTQyOTE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnergy major BP pledged yesterday \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bp-outlook/bp-boss-looney-sets-out-to-reinvent-oil-giant-with-zero-carbon-goal-idUSKBN2061IM?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto eliminate or offset all carbon emissions\u003c/a\u003e from its operations and the products it sells by 2050.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture before we dive in: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is arguably the biggest strategic change at BP in its 111-year history, but with big oil 1) at the center of a climate crisis and 2) struggling to appease green-minded investors, generational shifts in ideology feel right for 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow to the diving in\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBP isn’t the first big oil company to outline climate-friendlier goals, but its plan has one major distinction: BP aims to become a net zero carbon emitter in its own production plus cut the CO2 its customers create as they use that energy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMost of the energy sector’s emissions come from people and businesses \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1f66df4cb23e89da039517163ef80dc4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eusing their products\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. At BP, 55 million metric tons of carbon equivalent per year come from operations, while 360 million/year come from its oil + gas being operationa\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003elized\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo how does an oil and gas company solve a problem like CO2 pollution? BP will have to shift to cleaner energy sources while developing new tech to offset unavoidable emissions, aka yank CO2 from the atmosphere to make up for what it tosses up there.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e““It’s not the destination, it’s the journey” —Wayne Gretzky” —BP CEO Bernard Looney. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooney, who started last week, was heavy on “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51475379?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeye to the future\u003c/a\u003e” vibes announcing the plans but light on details like timing and costs. And the 30 years between now and 2050, as the WSJ puts it, “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/bp-wants-to-be-carbon-neutral-by-2050-11581517147?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprovides plenty of wiggle room\u003c/a\u003e.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat might need some wiggling: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBP allocated 3.2% of its budget last year to investing in renewable energy (the industry average is 7.4%).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the coming years, BP says it will reorganize to invest more in “low carbon businesses” and invest less in oil and gas. \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2020/feb/12/bp-sets-net-zero-carbon-target-for-2050?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIt’s unclear\u003c/a\u003e how that vision becomes reality, but we know this: BP’s new strategy could \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/bp-carbon-emissions-net-zero-goal-c2e39709-5c9b-45b7-9cb6-dc6de6dee7b5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eput pressure on U.S. oil majors\u003c/a\u003e who’ve mostly been silent on climate issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat had been a celebratory week for the smartphone world—Samsung’s event, the T-Mobile/Sprint merger—quickly turned dark. The industry’s largest trade show, Mobile World Congress, was \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/12/gmsa-cancels-mobile-world-congress-due-to-coronavirus-concerns/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceled\u003c/a\u003e by organizers because of the coronavirus outbreak. It had been scheduled to take place later this month in Barcelona.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMobile World Congress (MWC) is a huge deal, which means canceling it is a huge deal. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver 100,000 people from 200 countries head to Catalonia each year to network about networks. The show generates 14,100 part-time jobs. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWireless carriers and, recently, manufacturers and Big Tech firms are all mainstays.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut MWC was \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/12/21127754/mwc-2020-canceled-coronavirus-trade-show-phone-mobile-world-congress-gsma-statement?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno match for the coronavirus\u003c/a\u003e, which has stymied travel to and from China, a global hub for the smartphone industry. Roughly 5,000–6,000 people from China typically attend MWC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eOrganizers had to decide between canceling the event and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/10/coronavirus-hit-mobile-world-congress-attendance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efielding the practice squad\u003c/a\u003e. Some of the biggest players including Ericsson, Nokia, Amazon, LG, and Sony pulled out in recent weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Cardi B and Nicki Minaj. Add to the list of NYC feuds: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders and former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Tuesday, (Bronx-born) Blankfein \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/lloydblankfein/status/1227455415241363456?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e that (Brooklyn native) Sanders would “ruin our economy.” He also said Sanders “doesn’t care about our military” and “is just as polarizing as [President] Trump.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor good measure, he suggested that Sanders was such a weak candidate, Russians seeking to throw the U.S. election would be wise to support him. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSanders, whose platform includes taxing the rich and establishing a Hunger Games for hedge fund managers, won Tuesday’s New Hampshire Democratic primary. His hard-left policies are causing much concern among current Wall Streeters and its retiree community. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis isn’t a new show, just the latest episode. A year ago, Blankfein and Sanders \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/02/05/blankfein-hits-back-at-senators-over-stock-buybacks-the-money-doesnt-vanish.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTwitter-sparred\u003c/a\u003e over stock buybacks. And in 2012, \u003ca href=\"https://www.sanders.senate.gov/newsroom/video-audio/lloyd-blankfein-is-the-face-of-class-warfare?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSanders called Blankfein\u003c/a\u003e “the face of class warfare” from the Senate floor. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced yesterday\u003c/a\u003e it raised $93 million in a Series C funding round. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHeadspace ushers users through guided meditations...and its numbers are approaching transcendence. The app has over 62 million downloads and more than 2 million paid subscribers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eThe $93 million fundraise has two parts—$53 million in equity and $40 million in debt. Blisce led the equity round and Pacific Western Bank provided the debt. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe play: \u003c/strong\u003ehas three acts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHeadspace Health, the startup’s effort to integrate mindfulness into healthcare. The medical community hasn’t signed off on meditation as official medicine, so Headspace is investing in clinical research. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHeadspace’s enterprise arm, Headspace for Work. H4W supports people at 600+ employers, and revenue has doubled in each of the past two years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eInternational expansion. Headspace tapped a former Apple exec \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/02/12/headspace-raises-53-million-and-40-million-in-debt-as-it-pursues-clinical-validation-for-mindfulness/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto peddle\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its French and German iterations across the pond. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite how hard it is to book an OpenTable on Valentine’s Day (do it now for a shot at 4:35pm), the holiday actually does relatively little for the restaurant biz.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to Womply, Valentine’s Day 2019—a Thursday—\u003ca href=\"https://www.womply.com/state-of-local-restaurants-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eranked 94th in the year\u003c/a\u003e for consumer spending at local restaurants in the U.S., below even Cinco de Mayo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe should caveat: \u003c/strong\u003eRestaurants, particularly the dimly lit ones, do very well on Valentine’s Day, reporting a 30%–40% revenue increase from a typical day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut, as Bloomberg reports, any old Saturday night is \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-12/valentine-s-day-is-not-as-good-for-restaurants-as-you-d-think?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvariably better\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" for local restaurants than a weekday Valentine’s. Average Saturdays generate 19.9% of weekly revenue and Fridays 18.9%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003ethe most elaborate and well-executed corporate scam in history\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Valentine’s Day, restaurants struggle to accommodate almost all two-tops that tend to linger longer than usual.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what holiday takes the cake?\u003c/strong\u003e Unsurprisingly, Mother’s Day weekend, which accounts for the No. 1 and No. 2 top-grossing days of the year for local restaurants.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F12%2Fnew-report-reveals-valentines-day-isnt-lucrative-local-restaurants\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
